title: Science Task Performance Diagnosis and Feedback Competency Enhancement Through Eye-Tracking

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary scientific knowledge, data visualization interpretation skills, and project-based learning experience
context.additional_context: Learners participate in visualizing and analyzing real-time eye-tracking data using personal devices (BYOD). Collaborative learning emphasizes diagnosing and evaluating task strategies by comparing peer eye-movement patterns

learning_goals: Learners can infer peers' task-solving strategies (e.g., selected answers, problem-solving approaches) with 80% accuracy by analyzing eye-movement displays.
Learners can assess task performers' confidence levels on a three-tier scale (low/medium/high) with over 70% accuracy based on fixation patterns.
Learners can diagnose task performance competencies by comparing their own eye-tracking data with peers' and propose three or more improvement strategies.

resources: Eye-tracking software (e.g., Tobii Pro, Gazepoint), LMS (Learning Management System), scientific question dataset, data visualization templates

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
